DataElement.preferredDefinition: A test devised by Dr. Virginia Apgar to assess the overall health of a newborn upon birth. The test is administered at one and five minutes after birth and allows for the assignation of numerical values between zero and two for specific observations regarding skin color, pulse rate, reflex irritability, muscle tone and breathing._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:An assessment of the physical condition of an infant at the time birth; involves heart rate, muscle tone, respiratory effort, color, and reflex responsiveness._A test devised by Dr. Virginia Apgar to assess the overall health of a newborn upon birth. The test is administered at one and five minutes after birth and allows for the assignation of numerical values between zero and two for specific observations regarding skin color, pulse rate, reflex irritability, muscle tone and breathing._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.

The numerical sum between zero and ten that is computed from individual values of zero to two that are assigned to five different areas of interest in newborn screenings. These areas are breathing, muscle tone, pulse rate, reflex irritability and skin color.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader
